title: Why can't I share the playlists on Apple Music? - Quora

response.answer_text: I searched the Apple community regarding this issue only to find the answers given not only unsatisfying, but also the ability to reply had been greyed out. I reworded my question in any number of ways and finally got a solution. If you have Apple Music, even the free trial, you can share your playlists. All you need to do is to mess with your iCloud Music settings. You can do this (as of November of 2018) by clicking on settings on your iPhone, click on Music, and under the Music settings turn on “iCloud Music Library.” At this point, after you have closed and reopened your Apple music application you should be able to get the “Share playlist” option after the playlists have reloaded. This will also enable the “Show on my profile on search” option with a switch that will appear when you click on “edit” after you have selected a playlist. I hope this helps, as it frustrated me as well.
You actually can, you just can't collaborate and make cloud playlists that are updated on everybody's devices like social playlists.
